objects.name: Browniestxt
objects.string: Brownies bisa memiliki tekstur yang berbeda bergantung pada rasio mentega dan tepung yang digunakan

objects.name: dadargulungtxt
objects.string: Nama "dadar" berasal dari bahasa Melayu yang artinya "berlapis-lapis", sedangkan "gulung" bagaimana kue ini dibuat, yaitu dengan digulung seperti pancake.

objects.name: Pasteltxt
objects.string: Masuknya jajanan ini ke Indonesia bermula oleh orang-orang Belanda di kawasan Sunda Kelapa yang menjadi pusat perekonomian Belanda.

objects.name: kuelapistxt
objects.string: Di Jawa Tengah dikenal dengan nama “Lapis Talam”, sementara di Sumatera Utara dikenal dengan nama “Lapis Legit Karo”

objects.name: lumpiatxt
objects.string: Lumpia bisa dinikmati dengan dua cara, yaitu digoreng dan dimakan langsung saat masih basah.

objects.name: apemtxt
objects.string: Dalam filosofi Jawa, kue apem merupakan simbol pengampunan atau mohon ampun dari berbagai kesalahan.

eventsFunctionsExtensions.author: Tristan Rhodes (https://victrisgames.itch.io/)
eventsFunctionsExtensions.name: ShakeObject
description: Shake an object (position, angle or scale).
It can be used for:
- Hit or impact
- Object slowly rocking back and forth (like a ship)
- Simulate engine vibration, earthquake, or pulsing
The top-down RPG example uses this extension for damage animations ([open the project online](https://editor.gdevelop.io/?project=example://top-down-rpg)).

eventsBasedBehaviors.description:
Shake an object, using one or more ways to shake (position, angle).
This behavior can be used on any type of object.
eventsBasedBehaviors.name: ShakeObject_PositionAngle

eventsFunctions.description: Shake an object, using one or more ways to shake (position, angle). Make sure to "Stop shaking" before starting a new shake if it uses different parameters.
eventsFunctions.name: ShakeObject_PositionAngle
eventsFunctions.sentence: Shake object _PARAM0_ for _PARAM2_ seconds. Modify position amplitude _PARAM3_ on X axis and _PARAM4_ on Y axis, angle rotation amplitude _PARAM5_.  Wait _PARAM6_ seconds between shakes. Keep shaking until stopped: _PARAM7_

events.comment: Pass input parameters to global variables so that onScenePostEvents can use them
Determine if the shake should keep going until stopped
Add default values if none were provided
If duration is less than a single shake, increase duration to make 1 full shake

parameters.description: Amplitude of postion shake in X direction (in pixels)  (For example: 5)
parameters.name: PowerX

parameters.description: Amplitude of position shake in Y direction (in pixels)  (For example: 5)
parameters.longDescription: Use a negative number to make the single-shake move in the opposite direction.
parameters.name: PowerY

parameters.description: Amplitude of angle rotation shake (in degrees)  (For example: 5)
parameters.name: PowerAngle

parameters.description: Amount of time between shakes (in seconds) (Default: 0.08)
parameters.longDescription: For a single-shake effect, set it to the same value as "Duration".
parameters.name: TimeBetweenShakes

events.comment: Run once before every shake movement

events.name: Correct for drift and reset drift tracking variables

events.comment: Move to correct any drift from previous shake
Make initial shake NOT random so users can set a direction for a one-shake effect
After initial shake pick a random direction
Save that initial shake has been processed
Calculate the fraction of shake that occured during this frame
Increase change for the first half of the shake (move away from original values)
Decrease change the second half of the shake (return to original position)
Stop shaking when the duration has been reached (or if the stop shaking function was called)

events.name: Correct for drift and reset drift tracking variables

events.comment: Move to correct any drift from previous shake

eventsFunctions.description: Stop any shaking of object that was initiated by the Shake Object extension.
eventsFunctions.name: StopShaking

eventsFunctions.description: Check if an object is shaking.
eventsFunctions.fullName: Check if an object is shaking
eventsFunctions.name: IsShaking

eventsBasedBehaviors.description:
Shake an object, using one or more ways to shake (position, angle, scale)
This behavior can only be used on sprite objects.
eventsBasedBehaviors.name: ShakeObject_PositionAngleScale

eventsFunctions.description: Shake an object, using one or more ways to shake (position, angle, scale). Make sure to "Stop shaking" before starting a new shake if it uses different parameters.
eventsFunctions.name: ShakeObject_PositionAngleScale
eventsFunctions.sentence: Shake object _PARAM0_ for _PARAM2_ seconds. Modify position amplitude _PARAM3_ on X axis and _PARAM4_ on Y axis, angle rotation amplitude _PARAM5_, and scale amplitude _PARAM6_.  Wait _PARAM7_ seconds between shakes.  Keep shaking until stopped: _PARAM8_

events.comment: Pass input parameters to global variables so that onScenePostEvents can use them
Determine if the shake should keep going until stopped
Add default values if none were provided
If duration is less than a single shake, increase duration to make 1 full shake

parameters.description: Amplitude of postion shake in X direction (in pixels)  (For example: 5)
parameters.name: PowerX

parameters.description: Amplitude of position shake in Y direction (in pixels)  (For example: 5)
parameters.longDescription: Use a negative number to make the single-shake move in the opposite direction.
parameters.name: PowerY

parameters.description: Amplitude of angle rotation shake (in degrees)  (For example: 5)
parameters.name: PowerAngle

parameters.description: Amplitude of scale shake (in percent change)  (For example: 5)
parameters.name: PowerScale

parameters.description: Amount of time between shakes (in seconds) (Default: 0.08)
parameters.longDescription: For a single-shake effect, set it to the same value as "Duration".
parameters.name: TimeBetweenShakes

events.comment: Run once before every shake movement

events.name: Correct for drift and reset drift tracking variables

events.comment: Move to correct any drift from previous shake
Make initial shake NOT random so users can set a direction for a one-shake effect
After initial shake pick a random direction
Calculate object scale displacement, with linear decay over time
Save that initial shake has been processed
Calculate the fraction of shake that occured during this frame
Increase change for the first half of the shake (move away from original values)
Decrease change the second half of the shake (return to original position)
Stop shaking when the duration has been reached (or if the stop shaking function was called)

events.name: Correct for drift and reset drift tracking variables

events.comment: Move to correct any drift from previous shake

eventsFunctions.description: Stop shaking an object.
eventsFunctions.name: StopShaking

eventsFunctions.description: Check if an object is shaking.
eventsFunctions.fullName: Check if an object is shaking
eventsFunctions.name: IsShaking

eventsFunctionsExtensions.author: @4ian, Entropy, VegeTato
eventsFunctionsExtensions.name: Flash
eventsFunctionsExtensions.shortDescription: Make an object flash visibility (blink), color tint, object effect, or opacity (fade).
description: Make an object flash for a period of time so that it alternates between two different states.
Includes the ability to flash visibility (blink), color tint, object effect, or opacity (fade).
After adding a behavior to an object, you **trigger the effect** by using the **Flash action**.
This can be used to:
- Let players know they are invincible after being hit
- Catch player attention on the interface (for instance a "press start" text)

eventsFunctions.description: Color tint applied to an object.
eventsFunctions.fullName: Color tint applied to an object
eventsFunctions.name: ColorTint

eventsFunctions.description: Toggle an object effect.
eventsFunctions.name: ToggleEffect

eventsFunctions.description: Toggle color tint between the starting tint and a given value.
eventsFunctions.name: ToggleColorTint

events.name: Note: This function cannot be "public" until it properly handles objects without a starting color tint variable (NULL)
Swap between the starting tint and the given value

eventsFunctions.description: Toggle object visibility.
eventsFunctions.name: ToggleVisibility

parameters.description: Duration of the flashing, in seconds
parameters.longDescription: Use "0" to keep flashing until stopped.

eventsFunctions.fullName: Is object flashing a color tint
eventsFunctions.name: IsFlashing

eventsFunctions.name: Stop

propertyDescriptors.label: Flash duration
propertyDescriptors.description: Use "0" to keep flashing until stopped

propertyDescriptors.name: StartingOpacity

eventsFunctionsExtensions.author: @4ian
eventsFunctionsExtensions.name: Bounce
eventsFunctionsExtensions.shortDescription: Bounce the object off another object it just touched.
description: Provides an action to make the object bounce from another object it just touched.
> ⚠️ This *won't work* with Physics engine or Platformer characters. This is working with objects that are moved using actions or behaviors using **the forces**.
The Breakout-like example uses this extension to make balls bounce ([open the project online](https://editor.gdevelop.io/?project=example://breakout)).

eventsBasedBehaviors.description: Provides an action to make the object bounce from another object it just touched. Add a permanent force to the object and, when in collision with another one, use the action to make it bounce realistically.
eventsBasedBehaviors.name: Bounce

eventsFunctions.description:
Bounce the object off another object it is currently colliding with, according to the angle and the speed of forces applied on the object.
Make sure to test for a collision between the two objects before launching this action. All the forces will be removed from the object, and a new permanent force will be added to make the object bounce.
eventsFunctions.name: BounceOff

events.comment:
To bounce the object realistically, we first separate it from the obstacle. The collision engine will do it by moving the object through the shortest "normal vector" of the edge that was collided.
We store the position of the object before being moved so that we know the angle of this "normal vector". Once we know it, we add a force in the direction of the normal vector, and we add the difference between the normal vector and the previous angle of movement.

eventsFunctions.description:
Bounce the object off another object it is currently colliding with, according to the angle and the speed of forces applied on the object.
The bounce will always be calculated *to go toward the specified angle (the "normal angle")*. For example, if the object is arriving at this exact angle, it will bounce in the opposite direction.

Make sure to test for a collision between the two objects before launching this action. All the forces will be removed from the object, and a new permanent force will be added to make the object bounce.
eventsFunctions.fullName: Bounce off another object toward a specified angle
eventsFunctions.name: BounceOffSpecificAngle
eventsFunctions.sentence: Bounce _PARAM0_ off _PARAM2_ assuming a normal angle of _PARAM3_

events.comment:
Check if there is a collision between the object and an obstacle and if so, do the bounce by stopping the object and adding a force so that it goes in the "reflected" direction, using the "normal" angle provided. 
This provides a realistic bounce.

parameters.description: The "normal" angle, in degrees, to bounce against
parameters.longDescription: This can be understood at the direction that the bounce must go toward.
parameters.name: NormalAngle

eventsFunctions.description:
Bounce the object off another object it is currently colliding with, according to the angle and the speed of forces applied on the object.
The bounce will always be vertical, like if the object is *colliding a perfectly horizontal obstacle* (like the top/bottom of the screen in a pong game). For example, if the object is arriving with an angle of exactly 90 degrees, it will bounce in the opposite direction: -90 degrees.

Make sure to test for a collision between the two objects before launching this action. All the forces will be removed from the object, and a new permanent force will be added to make the object bounce.
eventsFunctions.name: BounceOffVertically

eventsFunctions.description:
Bounce the object off another object it is currently colliding with, according to the angle and the speed of forces applied on the object.
The bounce will always be horizontal, like if the object is *colliding a perfectly vertical obstacle* (like paddles in a pong game). For example, if the object is arriving with an angle of exactly 0 degrees, it will bounce in the opposite direction: 180 degrees.

Make sure to test for a collision between the two objects before launching this action. All the forces will be removed from the object, and a new permanent force will be added to make the object bounce.
eventsFunctions.name: BounceOffHorizontally

eventsFunctions.description: the number of times this object has bounced off another object.
eventsFunctions.name: BounceCount

propertyDescriptors.label: Bounce count
propertyDescriptors.description: Number of times this object has bounced off another object
propertyDescriptors.name: BounceCount

eventsFunctionsExtensions.name: Inventories
eventsFunctionsExtensions.description: Manage inventory items with limited or unlimited item capacity.

eventsFunctions.description: Add an item in an inventory.
eventsFunctions.name: AddItem

eventsFunctions.description: Remove an item from an inventory.
eventsFunctions.name: RemoveItem

eventsFunctions.description: the number of an item in an inventory.
eventsFunctions.name: ItemCount

eventsFunctions.description: Check if at least one of the specified items is in the inventory.
eventsFunctions.name: HasItem

eventsFunctions.description: the maximum number of the specified item that can be added in the inventory. By default, the number allowed for each item is unlimited.
eventsFunctions.name: ItemCapacity

eventsFunctions.description: Check if a limited amount of an object is allowed by the inventory. Item capacity is unlimited by default.
eventsFunctions.name: IsLimitedItemCapacity
eventsFunctions.sentence: Allow a limited count of _PARAM2_ in inventory _PARAM1_

eventsFunctions.description: Allow a limited amount of an object to be in an inventory. Item capacity is unlimited by default.
eventsFunctions.name: SetIsLimitedItemCapacity
eventsFunctions.sentence: Allow a limited count of _PARAM2_ in inventory _PARAM1_: _PARAM3_

eventsFunctions.description: Check if an item has reached its maximum number allowed in the inventory.
eventsFunctions.name: IsItemCapacityReached

eventsFunctions.description: Check if an item is equipped.
eventsFunctions.name: IsItemEquipped

eventsFunctions.description: Mark an item as being equipped. If the item count is 0, it won't be marked as equipped.
eventsFunctions.name: SetIsItemEquipped

eventsFunctions.description: Save all the items of the inventory in a scene variable, so that it can be restored later.
eventsFunctions.fullName: Save an inventory in a scene variable
eventsFunctions.name: CopyInventoryToVariable

eventsFunctions.description: Load the content of the inventory from a scene variable.
eventsFunctions.fullName: Load an inventory from a scene variable
eventsFunctions.name: CopyToVariableToInventory

eventsFunctionsExtensions.author: @4ian
eventsFunctionsExtensions.name: StayOnScreen
eventsFunctionsExtensions.shortDescription: Move the object to keep it visible on the screen.
description: Force the object to stay visible on the screen by setting back its position inside the viewport of the camera.
The shoot'em up example uses this extension ([open the project online](https://editor.gdevelop.io/?project=example://space-shooter)).

eventsBasedBehaviors.description: Force the object to stay visible on the screen by setting back its position inside the viewport of the camera.
eventsBasedBehaviors.name: StayOnScreen

eventsFunctions.description: the top margin (in pixels) to leave between the object and the screen border.
eventsFunctions.name: MarginTop

eventsFunctions.description: the bottom margin (in pixels) to leave between the object and the screen border.
eventsFunctions.name: MarginBottom

eventsFunctions.description: the left margin (in pixels) to leave between the object and the screen border.
eventsFunctions.name: MarginLeft

eventsFunctions.description: the right margin (in pixels) to leave between the object and the screen border.
eventsFunctions.name: MarginRight

eventsFunctionsExtensions.name: PinchGesture
eventsFunctionsExtensions.shortDescription: Move the camera or objects with pinching gestures.
description: This extension allows to:
* Move, rotate and/or zoom the camera according to pinch gestures
* Move, rotate and optionally scale objects according to pinch gestures
* Handle more specific needs with various expressions
Limitations:
* Only one pinching gesture is detected at a time

eventsFunctions.description: Enable or disable camera pinch.
eventsFunctions.name: EnableCameraPinch

eventsFunctions.description: Check if camera pinch is enabled.
eventsFunctions.name: IsCameraPinchEnabled

eventsFunctions.description: Choose the layer to move with pinch gestures.
eventsFunctions.name: SetCameraPinchLayer
eventsFunctions.sentence: Choose the layer _PARAM1_ to move with pinch gestures

eventsFunctions.description: Change the camera pinch constraint.
eventsFunctions.name: SetCameraPinchConstraint
eventsFunctions.sentence: Change the camera pinch constraint to _PARAM1_

parameters.name: Constraint

events.comment: Save the initial state because the pinch is calculated from here.
Backup the camera state to revert pinch effect according to constraints.

parameters.name: Constraint
parameters.supplementaryInformation: ["No constraint","Zoom only","Rotation only","Zoom and rotation only"]

events.comment: Pinch with more than 2 touches is not handled.
2nd touch started: save the 2 touches locations
It's important to do this case after because TouchCount is incremented in this loop (0 to 1 and 1 to 2 must not happen with the same touch event).

eventsFunctions.description: Check if a touch is pinching, if 2 touches are pressed.

eventsFunctions.description: Return the vertical translation of the pinch gesture from its beginning.

eventsFunctions.description: Return the new X position of a point after the pinch gesture.
eventsFunctions.name: TransformedX

parameters:
PinchGesture::CurrentCenterX("Layer") + PinchGesture::Scaling() * PinchGesture::RotatedVectorX(
  GetArgumentAsNumber("PositionX") - PinchGesture::BeginningCenterX("Layer"),
  GetArgumentAsNumber("PositionY") - PinchGesture::BeginningCenterY("Layer"),
  PinchGesture::Rotation()
)

eventsFunctions.description: Return the new Y position of a point after the pinch gesture.
eventsFunctions.name: TransformedY

parameters:
PinchGesture::CurrentCenterY("Layer") + PinchGesture::Scaling() * PinchGesture::RotatedVectorY(
  GetArgumentAsNumber("PositionX") - PinchGesture::BeginningCenterX("Layer"),
  GetArgumentAsNumber("PositionY") - PinchGesture::BeginningCenterY("Layer"),
  PinchGesture::Rotation()
)

eventsFunctions.description: Return the original X position of a point before the pinch gesture.
eventsFunctions.name: InversedX

parameters:
PinchGesture::BeginningCenterX("Layer") + PinchGesture::RotatedVectorX
(
  GetArgumentAsNumber("PositionX") - PinchGesture::CurrentCenterX("Layer"),
  GetArgumentAsNumber("PositionY") - PinchGesture::CurrentCenterY("Layer"),
  -PinchGesture::Rotation()
) / PinchGesture::Scaling()

eventsFunctions.description: Return the new position on the Y axis of a point after the pinch gesture.
eventsFunctions.name: InversedY

parameters:
PinchGesture::BeginningCenterY("Layer") + PinchGesture::RotatedVectorY
(
  GetArgumentAsNumber("PositionX") - PinchGesture::CurrentCenterX("Layer"),
  GetArgumentAsNumber("PositionY") - PinchGesture::CurrentCenterY("Layer"),
  -PinchGesture::Rotation()
) / PinchGesture::Scaling()

eventsBasedBehaviors.description: Move objects by holding 2 touches on them.
eventsBasedBehaviors.name: Pichable

events.comment: Only the objects with the highest Z-Order will be actually pinched (see doStepPostEvents).
Move the object according to the pinch gesture.

Only the objects with the highest Z-Order are actually pinched.
If all objects have the same Z-Order, they can all be picked at once.

eventsFunctionsExtensions.name: PanelSpriteButton
eventsFunctionsExtensions.shortDescription: A button that can be customized.
description: The button can be customized with a background for each state and a label. It handles user interactions and a simple condition can be used to check if it is clicked.
There are ready-to-use buttons in the asset-store [menu buttons pack](https://editor.gdevelop.io/?initial-dialog=asset-store&asset-pack=menu-buttons-menu-buttons).

eventsBasedBehaviors.description: The finite state machine used internally by the button object.
eventsBasedBehaviors.name: ButtonFSM

events.comment: The "Validated" state only last one frame.
Make sure the cursor position is only checked once per frame.
Touches are always pressed, so ShouldCheckHovering doesn't matter.

eventsFunctions.name: IsClicked

eventsFunctions.name: IsHovered

eventsFunctions.description: Check if the button is either hovered or pressed but not hovered.
eventsFunctions.name: IsFocused

eventsFunctions.description: Check if the button is currently being pressed with mouse or touch.
eventsFunctions.name: IsPressed

eventsFunctions.description: Check if the button is currently being pressed outside with mouse or touch.
eventsFunctions.name: IsPressedOutside

eventsFunctions.description: the touch id that is using the button or 0 if none.
eventsFunctions.name: TouchId

eventsBasedObjects.description: A button that can be customized.
eventsBasedObjects.name: PanelSpriteButton

events.comment:
Create one background instance for of each state.
Only the instance for the current state is shown.
Place the label over the backgrounds.
Show the right background accordingly to the new state.

Children instances must be resized when the button size change:
- backgrounds for each state are resized to take the full dimensions of the button
- the label is put back at the center of the button

The scale is set back to 1 because it means that the parent instance has the same dimensions as the union of its children instances.

eventsFunctionsExtensions.name: ButtonStates
eventsFunctionsExtensions.shortDescription: Use any object as a button and change appearance according to user interactions.
description: Use the "Button states" behavior to track user interactions with an object, including:
- Hovered
- Pressed
- Clicked
- Idle
Add additional behaviors to make juicy buttons with animated responses to user input:
- Size
- Color
- Animation
- Object effects
